algorithm_technique: BST traversal using parent pointers to find the in-order successor.
problem_summary_simple: Find the next node in an in-order traversal of a BST, given direct node access.
problem_summary_technical: Utilize parent pointers in a BST to find the in-order successor: if right child exists, find its leftmost descendant; otherwise, go up until a left turn is made.
time_complexity: O(h), where h is the height of the BST.
key_insights: The key difference from the previous problem is direct access to parent pointers.
If a node has a right subtree, the successor is the minimum element in that subtree.
If no right subtree, the successor is the first ancestor for which the current node is in its left subtree.
